author: Directgov
name: oneplace
notes:
### About 

From website:

> A powerful new website to help you understand how well your local services are working together to improve the problems affecting your community.

Collaboration of various UK government bodies:

> The website brings together the views of six independent inspectorates: the Audit Commission, Care Quality Commission, Ofsted, and Her Majesty's Inspectorates of Constabulary, Prisons and Probation.

### License

[Copyright page](http://oneplace.direct.gov.uk/legal/pages/copyright.aspx) states:

> Information can be re-used for the purposes of research for non-commercial purposes, for private study, or for news reporting and reviews, without requiring formal consent.

> However, if you wish to re-use the information for commercial purposes, including publishing, you are required to seek the permission of the relevant inspectorates (Audit Commission, Care Quality Commission, HM Inspectorate of Constabulary, HM Inspectorate of Probation, HM Inspectorate of Prisons and Ofsted), via the Audit Commission. Permission to re-use copyright information is granted in the form of a licence.
title: Oneplace
